communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

Electronic copies of the civil service photographs and/or personnel headshots on file for the following employees, all of whom work or have worked for Department of Corrections and Community Supervision (and before DOCCS's creation, the Department of Correctional Services).

- Ahearn, Kelly
- Albino, Jacqueline
- Ayotte, Darren
- Byrnes, Judith
- Cianfrocco, Louis
- Dawson, Jerome
- Ferro, James
- Fonda, Vernon
- Fosmire, BobbyJoe
- Lebel, Kenneth
- Marra, Stephen
- Martuscello, Catherine
- Martuscello, Christopher
- Martuscello, Daniel F Jr (likely in the system as Daniel F Martuscello)
- Martuscello, Daniel F III
- Martuscello, Nicholas
- Martuscello, Victoria
- Meigs, Charlotte
- Miller, Mark
- Nunez, Christian

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Chris Gelardi

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

The reports, sanctions, and associated documents related to ALL OEMS investigations that resulted in a resolution plan that includes a referral of the matter to the office of general counsel, agency action, issuance of cease and desist, settlement agreement, surrender of license, in calendar years 2022, 2023, and 2024 to date. 

This request includes all types of complaints, serious incidents and investigations, even if agency actions not (yet) issued. If general counsel has issued sanctions, please provide copies of all agency actions or associated documentation. Please include any cases pending agency action or appeal.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Glenn Stone

title: Drug and Gang Ordinance Landlord Letters

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Drug and Gang Ordinance Landlord Letters
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Any and all letters sent by Chicago Police Department to landlords and property owners from November 11, 2023 through December 31, 2023 for the purpose of enforcing Chicago Ordinance 8-4-090 (Drug and gang housing, houses of prostitution or other disorderly houses). 

If this request is too cumbersome, we would like specifically any letters sent by Officers David Montes, Wendy Pacino and Steve Losacco.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jenny Wadhwa
